input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Drinking coffee has a direct effect on room. The candle has a direct effect on room. The overall probability of drinking coffee is 17%. The probability of not drinking coffee and dark room is 77%. The probability of drinking coffee and dark room is 11%. Is the chance of dark room larger when observing drinking coffee?
